III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation From September 2022 to April 2023, youth and staff member had
at least 10 sexual encounters while on the grounds of the facility.
The sexual encounters involved penetration.
Investigation This complaint was received on 08/17/2023 and investigated in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist.
On 08/18/23, I reviewed two investigations involving Staff 1 and
Youth A with similar allegations:
• On 05/17/2023 SIR 2023C0000468 was investigated
alleging Staff 1 made inappropriate sexual comments and
touched Youth A inappropriately, there was rule violation
for Rule 400.4126 to support that Staff 1 was unable to
provide for the needs, protection, and supervision of youth.
• On 05/23/2023 SIR 2023C0000484 was investigated
alleging Staff 1 and Youth A were engaged in a sexual
relationship at the facility, there was rule violation for Rule
400.4112 to support that the facility was found in
noncompliance as Staff 1 had a confirmed case for
improper supervision. Staff 1 was terminated. In both
investigations Youth A refused to be interviewed.
I spoke with MDHHS Specialist 1 on 08/18/2023. She reported
Youth A is placed at Bay Pines facility, so MDHHS Specialist 2
went out on 08/18/2023 and verified the well-being of Youth A.
She said Youth A refused to speak to MDHHS Specialist 2 in the
previous investigation, so MDHHS Specialist did not attempt to
interview Youth A.
I spoke with Complainant/Probation Officer on 08/18/2023.
Probation Officer reported Youth A disclosed that when she was
placed at Lincoln Center, she had sexual intercourse with Staff 1.
No further information was reported.
I spoke with Lincoln Center Director on 08/21/2023 and informed
her of the complaint involving Staff 1. Staff 1 was terminated on
2

07/07/2023. She reported there was no prior reports or concerns
regarding Staff 1 having a sexual relationship with Youth A.
I spoke with MDHHS Specialist 1 on 08/30/2023. She arranged for
Youth A to be interviewed by her Probation Officer on 08/31/2023,
since Youth A will not speak to MDHHS Specialist.
On 08/31/2023 Youth A was interviewed by her Probation Officer
via video conference call. Youth A reported when she was placed
at Lincoln Center in February of 2023. Staff 1 and she had sexual
intercourse at least 10 times. She said it would happen when Staff
1 dispensed evening medication around 8 pm, Staff 1 would go in
her room, and they had sex in her room. Youth A could not recall
what Staff 1 was wearing and when they had sex. She said she is
the one that initiated the sexual relationship.
I spoke with Lincoln Center Director on 08/31/2023 in reference to
reviewing video coverage for the month in February. Director
reported video is only preserved for 90 days, therefore video for
the month of February 2023 was not available.
On 09/08/2023 a second video conference call was held with
MDHHS Specialist 1, Probation Officer, and Youth A. An attempt
was made by MDHHS Specialist to forensically interview Youth A.
Youth A refused to answer any questions and said she does not
want to speak to MDHHS or DCWL.
On 09/08/2023, I interviewed Highland Park Detective, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 1. Detective confirmed
receiving the law enforcement notification and will be contacting
Staff 1 to schedule an interview.
On 09/20/2023, Staff 1 was interviewed by Detective at Highland
Park Police Department. Staff 1 denied having a sexual
relationship with Youth A or any other youth at Lincoln Center. He
reported his only interaction with Youth A was when he passed
medication. He said the only time he went to Youth A’s room was
to do a room search when Youth A threatened to self-harm, and
he and another staff would search the room. He denied being in
Youth A’s room alone, having a sexual relationship, or talking to
Youth A about sex.
On 10/12/2023 a predisposition conference call was held with
MDHHS Specialist and management. There is a finding for sexual
abuse by Staff 1 resulting in his on central registry
3

Analysis These allegations were previously investigated in
SIR2023C0000464 and SIR2023C0000484 and the facility was
cited for Staff 1 making inappropriate comments, touching youths,
and having a confirmed case resulting in Staff 1 being terminated.
Therefore, there will not be any additional rule violations for this
investigation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
